responses: Graduate students at Clark University can apply for two types of assistance: merit-based scholarships, grants, and tuition waivers awarded by their department based on the admission application and supplemental information provided, and student loans. Scholarships can cover full or partial tuition, while loans must be repaid, typically after graduation. Eligibility for loans requires acceptance into a degree program and at least half-time enrollment.

responses: All applicants must complete the FAFSA (Free Application for Student Financial Aid) which can be completed https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/. Please note that our Title IV code number is 002139. In addition to the FAFSA

patterns: When is the deadline to submit the financial aid application?
What are the financial aid application deadlines for different start dates?
Can you provide more information about the financial aid priority deadlines?
Are there any consequences for missing the financial aid application deadlines?
Is it possible to request an extension for the financial aid application deadline?
responses: If you plan on starting your program during the summer, our priority deadline is May 1st. If you plan on starting in the fall semester, our priority deadline is June 1st. If you plan on starting in the spring, our priority deadline is December 1st. It is very important for you to meet these deadlines if you plan to use any financial aid funds to pay your student account.

responses: Cost of attendance is based on the number of units a student takes each semester. For a complete breakdown of the costs for your particular graduate program, please contact your department.

patterns: Are international students eligible for financial assistance at Clark University?
What options are available for financial assistance for international students?
Can international students apply for federal financial aid?
Is there a specific process for international students to apply for financial assistance?
Are there alternative financial aid options for international students?
responses: Clark University does not offer financial assistance directly to international students. International students are not eligible for federal financial aid, unless the student is an eligible non-citizen as defined by federal regulations. International students may apply for an alternative loan; however, a U.S. Citizen is required to co-sign the loan.

responses: You can visit our housing page to see housing options: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/on-campus-housing/graduate-housing/

On-campus job listings

responses: All the on campus jobs are posted on Handshake. Please check the posted part time on campus jobs on Handshake.

patterns: When can I apply for CPT?
What are the requirements for CPT?
When can I eligible for CPT?
When can I apply for Curricular Practical Training?
What are the eligibility criteria for Curricular Practical Training?
When am I eligible to apply for Curricular Practical Training?
At what point in my academic program can I start the application process for Curricular Practical Training?
What is the timeline for applying for Curricular Practical Training?
How soon can I begin the application procedure for Curricular Practical Training?
responses: Students must complete two full-time semesters (does not include summer) in the United States before they qualify for CPT. Exceptions to the one academic year requirement are provided for students enrolled in graduate studies that require immediate participation in curricular practical training.

patterns: Is there any transportation available for clark university students?
What transportation services does Clark University provide for its students?
Are there any shuttle services available for Clark University students?
How do students at Clark University access transportation services?
responses: ClarkRIDE is an on call, safe-ride program for students, faculty, and staff who need transportation to and from destinations within a one-mile radius of campus.

patterns: When can I apply for OPT?
When can I eligible for OPT?
What is the timeline to apply for OPT?
When should I start the OPT application process?
At what point can I begin the OPT application?
responses: You can apply for Optional Practical Training (OPT) up to 90 days before completing your degree program and up to 60 days after completing your degree program. It's recommended to apply as early as possible within this timeframe to allow for processing delay
